comments.body: Actually this kinda makes sense. They could drop 0-2 emeralds IMO, 2 being very rare.

Since Pillagers drop emeralds, Villagers trade in Emeralds, and Zombies have a low chance of spawning as a zombie villager...

Seems like this all makes sense.
I LOVE THIS IDEA üí°

I agree with adding them to raise awareness, but reading it, there seems to be little use, other than being a quirky parrot.
I think they should have the ability to scare spiders, as birds in real life, eat spiders.
TheIronSniper1, That's a really good idea! That would give them an actual use, other than for being cute. Credit for that goes to you!
Genius! Great idea.

I think they should spawn in forests instead of jungles. Everything spawns in jungles and it makes the other biomes very boring. Maybe make them spawn at night, too - because the real ones are nocturnal.

Additionally, having hostile mobs ignore them would make them sort of underwhelming. They should be hunted down by zombies, skeletons, all illagers, as well as wolves, foxes and cats.

I need it Now...If Mojang only adds Endangered animals, then they MUST add this,

 

 

but if not...

 

We need to make them more endangered.

 

(That was a Joke).
It's not really a pet but would love to see them in jungles
*bows down to water sheep*
W H A T ! ? You never played Tuber Simulator?
Maybe their could be a space on a horse for carpets to be laid behind the saddle, and then pets could be placed on the carpets.
They could also spawn in savanna biome in the wild as a green variant. The blue, white, and yellow variants could spawn in the jungle biome. They could make homes in trees to add a little more life.
In minecraft we already have cockatiel parrots, blue and gold macaw parrots, scarlet macaw parrots, green amazon parrots even a hayacinth macaw parrots.
I like it budige!

Maybe they could spawn wild in savannas instead of in villages so that you have to catch one in the wild just like with parrots and ocelots. They could travel in flocks (kind of like llamas) to make them less similar to parrots and can be tamed with seeds. The flock idea would be a bit hard to code because the budgies would have to move in a group, but not in a formation, doing the exact same thing. They could also settle around water holes like the way parrots are drawn to other mobs.

It would be fun if some wild budgies could spawn blue or yellow (which would be rare) or some of them have more blue or yellow than others. Then you could catch some and breed them for certain colours. Most wild budgies would be green. Breeding them would be like breeding pandas. They each have a dominant gene and a hidden gene, and sometimes mutations occur. They could also have a dominant gene and a hidden gene for different feather patterns (like pieds and opalines).

If possible, there could also be male and female budgies (identified by the cere, the area above the beak).
it should be if the player hasn't slept for 120+ nights. Builders often work through the night so 30 nights isn't enough time.

I do think there needs to be a boss that drops elytra. The elytra is too important of an item to be finite, only in the finite amount of end cities. On big multiplayer servers it can be extremely hard to get elytra, yet they've changed the game so drastically that they should be available. It obviously should still take a lot of work to get them and only after beating the dragon but they should be renewable. A phantom boss would be cool. I'd suggest some sort of grindy process to spawn it similar to spawning the wither where you have to kill mobs for rare drops to spawn it.

phantoms do have a size tag so you can simply use the command below

 

/summon minecraft:phantom ~ ~ ~ {size:64}

you can enter any number through 100 in the size box above
this was like an idea i had where you don't sleep for thirty days then go to bed and your teleported to a sub-realm island where you fight a giant phantom that spawns in other phantoms
I love your idea, but could you give more of a visual of this Phantom king?

It's so creepy to fight phantoms during nights illuminated by lightnings. A phantom boss could be found in large areas without mobs.
 It would create storms with wind that slows down the player. Due to the dust raised by the wind and the rain the player would not be able to see around him and the boss would be illuminated by random lightnings. The boss could attack with very loud screams and cause negative effects by looking at the player with its eyes for a few seconds. When it reaches a low standard of living, it would call some normal phantoms to help it, they will be able to see even in the dust.
The Phantom boss would be a giant phantom with more details on the wings, including veins as green as its eyes. Being injured its wings would tear and spots of green blood would appear on its body.
Defeating it would drop many levels of experience, phantom membrane and a pupil of its eyes, which can be used to create a device to see very far away, even at night and underwater. A kind of telescope.
Maybe it could have a new use in the different variants. I like this idea!
this would be amazing, especially with how allay are to find in the 2 structures (Pillager Outpost and woodland mansion)
I say you should at a titan ender dragon using a new ritual with ender crystals, like the boss of a boss!

Nightlights would be a new type of allay, but they would be yellow. It could be tamed using a cookie. They can glow like a torch to help you see in the dark. You can give the nightlight an item and it will pretend to use it. It could read a book, look through a telescope, pretend to go fishing, pretend to attack mobs with a sword, ect. Like an allay, it can also regenerate itself when it is hurt. This would be an amazing Minecraft pet.

There could also be an allay variant called an alliar (pronounced "a liar"). It would look the same as an allay, but have a pixel on its back in between its wings. It would work like an allay but not give you the item you gave it back, or give you any more items.
It would appear that golden allays build structures in Minecraft Legends as the game just came out.

Perhaps we could have Lost Guardians stuck in sand or rubble, and awaken when they sense a player, I can imagine a new player stumbling across one and wondering what it is, only for it to awaken and provoke a fierce fight.

I think this is a great idea
I just love the fact that the deep dark is just the horror game side of minecraft! Also I think that these mobs shouldn't make sounds except for when the notice you and their squishy foot steps.
I love the idea of the Sculk just being this big corrupting force, maybe Sculk can corrupt overworld foliage if brought up to the surface with non-organic blocks stopping the corruption

I was about to post the same thing until i saw this and it is a great idea in fact like you cant add a new biome or cave without a couple of new mobs and it does make sense with the games lore if the warden is a past builder but got infected by the sculk or is basically a prison guard making sure the souls are trapped in its chest and mobs will be infected because they are trapped too.

I like it, but there is a couple issues, firstly, this one might just be me, but it would be really difficult for skeletons to shoot you, second, I feel like this makes the Warden less unique than it was before. giving normal mobs sensors and blindness takes away everything that makes the Warden special, the only thing that separates it from normal mobs is the Warden's massive strength and it's appearance. Like I said, I like the idea, but it takes away most the uniqueness of the Warden.
We just need another sculk mob! One way or another.

I think yes but the Warden must also keep its uniqueness I think a new silverfish variant sculkmite should be there ... its is too small to be noticed by the warden but large enough to hit you hard and also call nearby warden
I think its a grate idea!
I think this is cool, but mobs spawning in the deep dark doesn't sound like much fun, since they'd set off the shriekers constantly.
I have been wanting this since my first encounter with the ancient city!!!
They can't even hear. just sense vibrations.

It would make sense if they were hostile to everything but then again would that defeat the point of having other mobs as the warden would easily kill them all? If this were to be implemented then perhaps there should be a feature making some hostile mobs silent as well. creepers are quiet mobs already so perhaps it wouldn't notice them. Maybe the idle sounds of other mobs would be more silenced. It would definitely increase the whole 'creepy' vibe.
And to some daring players they can trap this beast and use it as a mob grinder.
They shouldn‚Äôt be able to hear the other mobs but sense their vibrations
totally voting, that's a really good idea. I think that when you break the nest, it should give you 1-4 sticks and 1-3 phantom membranes.

I think a new major update could be the ‚ÄúTropical Treats update‚Äù where you could include:mangoes,pineapple,coconuts,obsidian tools and armor which slow you down but gives you resistance, volcanoes which can erupt, tribal villagers, island torches, tribal masks, palm trees emerald swords and armor, new ore called Levite, armor would burn whoever touched it and the sword would set the enemy on fire,waves on the ocean, natural disasters(tsunami,tornado,hurricane,and floods and a setting to turn them off) seals, black coral, umbrellas and lawn chairs, manta rays, and coconut crabs( can be found on beaches and palm trees and look exactly like a coconut, if you pick a coconut crab, They drop down and become hostile and take all the fruit off the tree it was on, and throws it at you including other coconut crabs on that tree)

Forgot to add this: if a coelacanths is dragged onto land, it will quickly lose energy and die, even if it is put back in the water afterwards.

Coelacanths are really cool animal and I'd love to see them in-game (albeit I admit having a heavy bias towards sea creatures because the oceans are my favourite ecosystems and host most of my favoured animals.) I personally don't know whether I like the idea of having the coelacanth being used as a source of oil for lamps though, since it's a rather rare animal and there are plenty of easier light sources, like torches and lanterns. but the potion of defence would be a really cool idea, and having it be obtainable via a deep-sea fish is a unique concept, and gives more reason to explore the depths, which is something that I am always for in this game! (could do with a better name tho, at least IMO, perhaps Potion of Hardening or Potion of Calcification could work?)
Turtle shells already do the scale thing

Nice idea but maybe not as common mob but some kind of smaller boss.
And oil that drops could be used to make oil lamp that can be held in off hand as portable light source
The oil lamp sounds good.
If you bring them into the Nether and feed them quartz would they do the same? What would you feed them to get them to look for Ancient Debris? Ancient Debris or Nether Scrap?
I'm thinking of enabling them to do that. But they're not really Nether mobs so unfortunately they won't be able to dig through Netherrack. Only the blocks mentioned.

It would not be bad if they could be divided into classes (that is, workers, guards and aggressors)

and make them diverse depending on the biomes in which they spawned.

I love the idea and the name! Oreptile dung should have a purpose, though, if it‚Äôs going to be added. I guess it would act like a trail to the ore they‚Äôre digging to, but the block itself needs to have a purpose. Maybe it could be used as fuel in a furnace?
Yes! Great idea! Would love to see more variations of cows. Also, you can get woolly pigs (look hilarious and super cute) so would also be cool to see these occasionally!
I like the idea of the Wooly Cow in Normal minecraft. Nice Job!:)

It would be great because now the Bane of Arthropods enchantment would finally be useful. I want it to be a very strong and big mob, though.

I want a boss like this, and was actually going to suggest it! Suggested tweaks: Web spinning would be similar to guardian beams, in that a thread can be traced back to the queen and that it takes time to create a cobweb on a block. She would have two attacks: a dropping or slashing one from her abdomen or legs and a pouncing or charging one that deals poison damage. At 2/3 of her original health, she would summon spider minions and accelerate web spinning. At 1/3, she would summon cave spider minions and accelerate her web spinning more. I hope you like my suggestions!

First You gotta take a walk through the Savanna or up the mountain crags to Find em. Now if yer' lookin' for trouble, you'll surely find it. Otherwise, the Gryphons mind their own. Unless'n yer' a sheep. Then they'll carry ya off for a feast of mutton.

Muttons also the way to their heart you see. You feed a Gryphon enough mutton and they'll tolerate ye' riding on their back. They won't take ya as fast as a Horse will, but keep him fat and happy on mutton and they'll gladly fly ya over that offending ravine.

Once ye tame em, they won't mind Torches none. But Iffin' a Golden Gryphon soars down from it's acacia roost to snatch the sheep right out of your pen, a torch will scare em right off.

(Savanna/Mountain biome, neutral(unless yer' a sheep), pick up and carry sheep. Tame via mutton, feed to fill a flight bar. Slower than a horse to keep the horse useful. Wilds scared away by Torches)
Gryphon's are a must for the Minecraft lands
